task_summary: Robot perceives a T-shaped block, approaches, aligns, and executes a series of pushes to drive the block toward a fixed target zone, then retreats.
assumptions: t_block and target_zone are visible or discoverable by scanning
end-effector yaw can be discretely set to 0° or 90°

symbolic_targets.target_zone: the green/blue outlined goal shape on the table

node_specs.description: Store symbolic names for later nodes.
Check if the object is currently detected.
Active search for the target with a specified scan pattern.
Move above the object at a safe Z offset.
Discretely set the tool yaw for pushing direction.
Approach the block and align contact normal within tolerance.
Execute a directed push of the specified distance.
Back off from the object after task completion.
Retry its single child until success or attempts exhausted.
Run children in order; stop on first failure.
Try children in order until one succeeds.

local_annotations.description: EE over table; goal outline visible; preparing to detect t_block.
t_block and target outline visible; align yaw for side push.
Approach and align to initiate first push along -X (180°).
Execute push distance 0.1 along 180°; block translates toward goal.
Small reposition to set up a second translation push.
Second push 0.1 along 180°; block advances closer to outline.
Yaw set to 0°; small reposition and corrective push 0.05 along 270°.
Block rests near/within target outline; wait and retreat.

failure_modes: insufficient push distance due to friction or obstruction
recovery_strategy: re-scan and re-approach if visibility is lost
repeat push sequence with adjusted yaw (0°/90°) if drift observed
fallback to operator if repeated retries fail

expected_success_criteria: t_block overlaps target_zone with position error < 2 cm
final yaw within 10° of target orientation
